content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Central Production Hub at position(0.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
- Wooden chest at position(0.5, 0.5) serving as the central resource storage depot.
- Stone furnace at position(1.0, -1.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Stone furnace at position(3.0, 1.0) smelting copper ore into copper plates.

### Research Lab at position(6.5, 6.5)
Consists of:
- Lab at position(6.5, 6.5) configured with 10 automation science pack(s) for research (status: NO_POWER).
- Connected small electric poles at positions (9.5, 6.5), (8.5, 6.5), and (10.5, 7.5) forming an electricity network.

### Steam-Powered Electricity Generator at position(-6.0, 24.5)
Consists of:
- Boiler at position(-6.0, 24.5) used for steam generation; now fueled with 10 coal. Warnings: [“no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”]. Connection points: (-5.5, 22.5) and (-5.5, 26.5); steam output point: (-7.5, 24.5).
- Offshore pump at position(-9.5, 24.5) for water extraction with connection point at (-9.5, 23.5).
- Pipe network elements:
 • PipeGroup (fluid_system=733) at position(-2.5, 20.5) with pipes at [(-2.5, 20.5), (-3.5, 20.5), (-3.5, 21.5), (-1.5, 20.5)] (status: EMPTY).
 • PipeGroup (fluid_system=734) at position(-8.5, 22.5) with pipes at [(-8.5, 22.5), (-8.5, 23.5), (-9.5, 23.5), (-7.5, 22.5)] (status: FULL_OUTPUT, fluid: water).
 • PipeGroup (fluid_system=736) at position(-7.5, 25.5) with pipes at [(-7.5, 25.5), (-7.5, 24.5)] (status: EMPTY).
- Steam engine (Generator) at position(-1.5, 26.5) intended for electricity generation; warnings: [“not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”]. Connection points: left at (-4.0, 26.5) and right at (1.0, 26.5).

ERROR TIPS
──────────────────────
• Steam Engine Placement:
 – Verify that chosen placement coordinates are free of water and obstructions. Attempts at (-5.0, 27.0) and (-4.5, 25.5) were rejected due to footprint collisions.
 – When using the nearest_buildable tool, ensure that the resulting buildable area aligns well with the intended placement zone.

• Pipe Connection Failures:
 – Ensure that fluid source and target endpoints match the required configurations. Errors such as “Fluids currently at source Prototype.Pipe … not needed and expected by the target” indicate misalignment in connection parameters.
 – Confirm that connection points for the boiler, steam engine, and offshore pump are unblocked and compatible before initiating pipe connections.
 – Avoid reversing source and target parameters unless their validity has been verified.

• Fuel Management:
 – Always verify that the boiler has sufficient fuel before operation. Harvesting and inserting coal resolved the initial “boiler out of fuel” issue; maintain an adequate fuel supply in inventory.

• Network Stabilization:
 – Allow proper waiting periods (10–20 seconds) for the fluid network to stabilize and for steam propagation before reattempting placements or connections.
